title: WOX11-LBD16 double partner dancing: a feedback circuitry for crown root development in rice
content: In cereals, the primary root degenerates after germination, but adventitious roots, also known as crown roots (CRs), persist throughout the plantâ€™s life cycle. CRs emerge from underground shoot nodes and constitute the primary elements of the root system, serving crucial functions in nutrient absorption, stress resilience, and overall yield (Rogers and Benfey 2015). The regulation of CR development in rice involves WUSCHEL-related homeobox (WOX) and lateral organ boundaries domain (LBD) transcription factors. Yet, the precise molecular mechanisms governing these regulatory processes in rice remain elusive.
